entry.title: ShoomShoom
entry.content:
Shoom Shoom

An independent game demo created by me and my friend オウシン(Chen Wang)

The game itself is still under development, we will strive to make a complete gaming experience.

We have created a complete world view and story framework for the game, and carefully designed characters, story, and gameplay. We hope you will enjoy it.

Click   Here   to play!

Or check the Github repo here  

The game is about a small mouse named Shoom Shoom, who lives in the underground city in a steampunk world.
He uses his homemade steam machinery and weapons to smuggle goods for customers in order to survive.

How to Play

You can use wd or ←→ to move left and right.
Use shift to run.
Use space to jump.

Project Structure

I use Unity3D as the game engine.
Also includes these functionalities:

  • URP
    To make the scene more beautiful.
    Add ShaderGraph to create special render effect(like the water and the shadow of water reflected on the wall behind)

  • UniRx
    Reactive state control.
    Script sequence control.

  • DoTween
    tween animation.
    For example the camera movement.

  • Cinemation
    Camera control.

  • Spine Unity Runtime
    For implement the spine animations I have created.

I also created the spine animations for shoom shoom and his enemies. (Will create more in the future…)

entry.title: Stupitoma
entry.content:
A stupid tomato is trying to across the road without dying.

Click Here to play!

Or check the Github repo here  

This is a game demo using CocosCreator. I have draw the sprites and programmed the whole stuff. Click to start. Once you clicked, your toma will go forward to across the road. If you click the left side of the screen, your toma will turn left and stop (as it is stupid, not able to walk and see in the same time), meanwhile you shall not see the right side. Vice versa.

entry.title: Sleepy DaVinci Code
entry.content:
A DaVinci code board game.

Rule:
Reveal all of your opponent’s secret code before they crack yours!


(Click ↑ to watch a demo video)

Click   Here   to play!

Or check the Github repo here  

Project Structure

This is a game demo using

  • Frontend: Pixi.js, React (Next.js) and GSAP
  • Backend: Node, Express and Socket.io
  • DB: Redis as data cache
  • Construct and deploy: Docker, Nginx

For this game, I have designed the whole system, the art base and picked up the technologies I needed.

I have finished the programming part all by myself.

One of my friend has draw the most of the sprites for me. (A great thanks here)

For the demo server, I have bought a VPS from Linode and built a docker + nginx deploy flow. I was planed to use AWS or Google Cloud, however I found it is a little bit waste to deploy such a small project using them. Also I can learn more by using a brand new server out of box.

I am still working on improving the game. I hope you will enjoy it.

entry.title: Sleepy Scene Tool (for Unity)
entry.content:
Sleepy Scene Tool (for Unity)

Don’t you feel that it is frustrating when you have an enter scene so that every time you need to start the game, you gonna have to go to that enter scene then hit the start button.

Isn’t it annoying that your scene file hidden in the project hierarchy and you have to use the search bar to find the scene you wanna use.

In the begining I thought that I can find a good plugin for this, but no, either are they too hard to use or they are expensive.

So I thought, why not create my own one. So, boom, voila, the Sleepy Scene Tool is here:
